thread.title: Cooler weather prompts water parks' closure at Disney, SeaWorld
thread.title_full: Cooler weather prompts water parks' closure at Disney, SeaWorld

author: Dewayne Bevil
title: Cooler weather prompts water parks' closure at Disney, SeaWorld
text:
Cooler weather prompts water parks' closure at Disney, SeaWorld Blizzard Beach Walt Disney Co. Cool temps will keep Goofy and company out of Blizzard Beach and other water parks later this week. High in the mid 60s are expected on Wednesday and Thursday in Orlando Cool temps will keep Goofy and company out of Blizzard Beach and other water parks later this week. High in the mid 60s are expected on Wednesday and Thursday in Orlando (Walt Disney Co.) Dewayne Bevil and SeaWorld Orlando .
Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon, which reopened Sunday after its annual maintenance period, and Disney’s Blizzard Beach, will not be open to guests on Wednesday or Thursday. It is scheduled for regular hours on Friday and beyond, a Disney World spokesman said Monday afternoon. 
Aquatica, SeaWorld’s water park, will be closed on Wednesday. No decision has been set for Thursday, a SeaWorld Orlando spokeswoman said Monday afternoon. 
A Legoland Florida spokesman said the resort’s water park was still scheduled to be open through the week. The attraction reopened after a winter break this weekend. 
Although balmy by northern standards this week, midweek’s high temperatures are expected to be in the mid 60s with lows in the low 40s. A return to the 70s is forecast for Friday. 
The cold snap is ill-timed because many schools are on spring break, which traditionally prompts a surge in visitors in Central Florida’s tourism corridor. On Sunday, Typhoon debuted a family raft ride dubbed Miss Adventure Falls.
